intro: Danaea ulei, commonly known as the red-leaved danaea, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking, velvety red leaves that are often variegated with green. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the warmer months. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Danaea ulei is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and ease of care.
